front.title: Guidelines for Extending the Extensible Provisioning Protocol

abstract.t: The Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) is an application layerclient-server protocol for the provisioning and management of objectsstored in a shared central repository. Specified in XML, theprotocol defines generic object management operations and anextensible framework that maps protocol operations to objects. Thisdocument presents guidelines for use of EPP's extension mechanisms todefine new features and object management capabilities.
